text: Is it possible to create smart content based on how many times a user visit a landing page ? For example, on my first visit I see the default content and on the second visit I show them more personalized content
<@U22PKFRU5> we got a guy who’s doing his first HubSpot CMS job this fall
Yes, using a list as the personalization option

<https://news.walpolepartnership.com/> - Do you have any recommendation how can I make the image unsquashed in Popular tab? Similar to recent post? I tried max-heigth but it's not working. I tried to put height: auto but the images stretch.
How do I know how many times a user has visited my page ? That's where I'm stuck at ?
if you want to segment for a specific page, use the _Page view_ filter. Otherwise, look for the contact property _Number of visits_
this is only possible for identified contacts though, not unidentified visitors
Awesome, I'll try this. Looks like it's gonna work
Thanks again
<@U22PKFRU5> we have just one arriving this monday

Great! - thanks yall - will follow up with each one of you individually.
Community - Keep these coming! Very helpful :raised_hands:

Is there a way to set a display condition for a field that uses “>=“? As in “if field ‘a’ is greater than 2, display this field as well.” I see there are display conditions “equals,” “is not equal to,” and so on. There is also the “custom regex” field--and the documentation is a little foggy as to what can be done with this.
Figured out a solution. Doesn’t seem like I can use >= but can just use a regex with a arbitrarily high number to get the same effect. Like [0-20] or something.
in the above, the href in the `<v:` tag doesnt get params applied, however, they apply to the normal a tag. Anyone know of any other good cross email client buttons you can make?
This is a big issue as im trying to make a nice call to action button and basically cant get params to post automatically in clients like outlook

for those who may have the same issue I used this button builder instead:
<https://codepen.io/rkimberlyc/pen/MJjYar>

Here’s a very similar one <https://buttons.cm/>

Generates the V code and everything
<@U7SL518D6> That is teh one that i have used
I made a module out of it for our emails.
yea thats one that is having issues
the link you put inside of the `v:` portion of the code doesnt get the params appended
GD Outlook
it was weird because it appended them for the clients like gmail and more but when the email was sent to outlook busts
Outlook needs to get with the times
im sure outlook online probably works but i havent checked it
yea it works in the online version, its the desktop client that doesnt do it
Online Outlook isn't chained to the awful Word HTML engine
I was just checking, one never knows with MS lol
I would actually be pretty impressed at the dedication if they managed to replicate all the bugs in desktop Outlook in a browser :stuck_out_tongue:
haha so would i

Can we set the HubSpot language picker module to automatically show the translation that corresponds with the visitor's browser settings? For some reason I thought I had seen that setting somewhere but now I can't find it.

~If someone checks this box and updates, is this a HubSpot wide thing or just a portal wide thing? I know i've checked it on another portal but for some reason I am not getting emails from other portals now.~
ignore the above, solved our issue for not getting the emails
